1: <sup>1</sup> A false balance is abomination to the LORD: but a just weight is his delight.
2: <sup>2</sup> When pride cometh, then cometh shame: but with the lowly is wisdom.
3: <sup>3</sup> The integrity of the upright shall guide them: but the perverseness of transgressors shall destroy them.
4: <sup>4</sup> Riches profit not in the day of wrath: but righteousness delivereth from death.
5: <sup>5</sup> The righteousness of the perfect shall direct his way: but the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.
6: <sup>6</sup> The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them: but transgressors shall be taken in their own naughtiness.
7: <sup>7</sup> When a wicked man dieth, his expectation shall perish: and the hope of unjust men perisheth.
8: <sup>8</sup> The righteous is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked cometh in his stead.
9: <sup>9</sup> An hypocrite with his mouth destroyeth his neighbour: but through knowledge shall the just be delivered.
10: <sup>10</sup> When it goeth well with the righteous, the city rejoiceth: and when the wicked perish, there is shouting.
11: <sup>11</sup> By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted: but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.
12: <sup>12</sup> He that is void of wisdom despiseth his neighbour: but a man of understanding holdeth his peace.
13: <sup>13</sup> A talebearer revealeth secrets: but he that is of a faithful spirit concealeth the matter.
14: <sup>14</sup> Where no counsel is, the people fall: but in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.
15: <sup>15</sup> He that is surety for a stranger shall smart for it: and he that hateth suretiship is sure.
16: <sup>16</sup> A gracious woman retaineth honour: and strong men retain riches.
17: <sup>17</sup> The merciful man doeth good to his own soul: but he that is cruel troubleth his own flesh.
18: <sup>18</sup> The wicked worketh a deceitful work: but to him that soweth righteousness shall be a sure reward.
19: <sup>19</sup> As righteousness tendeth to life: so he that pursueth evil pursueth it to his own death.
20: <sup>20</sup> They that are of a froward heart are abomination to the LORD: but such as are upright in their way are his delight.
21: <sup>21</sup> Though hand join in hand, the wicked shall not be unpunished: but the seed of the righteous shall be delivered.
22: <sup>22</sup> As a jewel of gold in a swine’s snout, so is a fair woman which is without discretion.
23: <sup>23</sup> The desire of the righteous is only good: but the expectation of the wicked is wrath.
24: <sup>24</sup> There is that scattereth, and yet increaseth; and there is that withholdeth more than is meet, but it tendeth to poverty.
25: <sup>25</sup> The liberal soul shall be made fat: and he that watereth shall be watered also himself.
26: <sup>26</sup> He that withholdeth corn, the people shall curse him: but blessing shall be upon the head of him that selleth it.
27: <sup>27</sup> He that diligently seeketh good procureth favour: but he that seeketh mischief, it shall come unto him.
28: <sup>28</sup> He that trusteth in his riches shall fall; but the righteous shall flourish as a branch.
29: <sup>29</sup> He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind: and the fool shall be servant to the wise of heart.
30: <sup>30</sup> The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; and he that winneth souls is wise.
31: <sup>31</sup> Behold, the righteous shall be recompensed in the earth: much more the wicked and the sinner.
